review_blob: Nice IPA, I thought this was very well done. Nice Hop nose with a lingering flavor of citrius. Had on Tap at the Houston Gingerman.
Great ale. Execelent hop flavor and nose. Nice deep amber color. Excelen t hop flavor with malty and yeasty tones.
This beer was decent, but not overly impressive. Nice orange color, drop dead headand  decent flavor. I had expected much more from this beer.
Brilliant floral nose, deep amber color with a nice fluffy head.  Well ballanced for a beer of this size.
beer_name: Avery The Maharaja Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Excelent beer, this is the hoppiest NBB beer ever reliesed to the public. The dry hopped aroma doninated on the nose with hints of fresh cut grass and carmel. Dry on the palatewith excellent hop flavor. Perfectly carbonated for this style of beer. Excelent lace in the glass and a wonderful lingering hop finish.  I also got this from a sample case.
This beer kicks ass. I do have to admit I am a big saison fan and this beer is true to style. Much better the NBBs old saison. Golden and hazy very effervescent and yummy spice. Top Notch.

Great version if a IPA. This is by far the hoppiest beer to ever come out of New Belgium. Deep Copper color with hints of bananna and clove on the nose, with a nice finishing warmth.

If you can find it you should definately give it a try.
Classic belgian ale. Deep golden straw color with a nose of pairs. Yeasty, malty and smooth.  Yummy!!
This was a great beer. The deep amber was cperfect for this beer. Hoppy, Malty with a nice bite of alcohol.  This one is one for the record books.

I was dissapointed with this beer. I absolutely love Dogfish, but I thought this beer was not up to their standard. It had a nice malty nose with hits of coffee and dark chocolet and pepper. The body was decent, but the flavor was just not there for me. I to me this was reminicent of a home brew trying to hit many different styles, but not hitting any one.

Nice Floral citrusy nose. The color was a dark copper with a short lived head. However the carbonation was off on the pint I drank. This beer had a nice hop flavor set is a bed of dark chololet.  It was a nice beer.
Rounded peppery mose with hints of oleander.  A very nice citrius flavor, which I look for in a IPA. The deep copper color is perfect for this american IPA.

This review is for a 1996 Abbey Grand Cru. This beer was stored in a dark wine room at 75 degrees. This beer had a strong aroma of alcohol when poured in to the glass, however the aroma was deceiving. The Abbey poured a deep mahogany color with notes of raison and plum on the nose. The mouth feel was excellent leaving a lingering taste on the palate. This was a definite treat.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Grand Cru Abbey Ale
